dt: {bc}to end the observance or effect of (something, such as a law) {bc}to completely do away with (something) {bc}{sx|annul||}

et: Middle English {it}abolysshen{/it}, borrowed from Middle French {it}aboliss-{/it}, stem of {it}abolir{/it} "to abolish," borrowed from Latin {it}abolēre{/it} "to destroy, efface, put an end to," perhaps formed from {it}abolēscere{/it} "to shrivel up, be effaced, fall into disuse," from {it}ab-{/it} {et_link|ab-|ab-} + {it}-ol-{/it}, medial form of the base of {it}alere{/it} "to nourish, bring up" + {it}-ēsc-{/it}, inchoative suffix {ma}{mat|old:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to end the observance or effect of (something, such as a law) : to completely do away with (something) : annul
